comment: A great Spider-man movie. Michael Keaton really steals the show as the Vulture. Tom Holland totally nailed both Spider-man and Peter Parker. My only fault with the film was Marisa Tomei looks way too young to be Aunt May.
Really good superhero movie. I loved the added comedy to his film. Tom Holland makes a very likeable Spider-man! Would recommend.

If i had money enough i would see this movie 10 times more on cinemas. Seriously, i loved it! Tom Holland is an amazing Spider-Man, Michael Keaton is an amazing Voulture and the supporting cast is also great. The screeplay is so awesome, very well written. Loved every second of it. Recommend.

Saw a review of this and was convinced I wasn't going to like the "New" backstory or film at all.
I was wrong. Also the review said there's nothing to spoil in the movie - there is - and it's quite a bigger so hurry up and watch it already!

Very enjoyable, very funny, perfect casting, good score. It felt like a superhero movie from the early 2000s, and I'm pretty sure Tom Holland IS Spiderman in his spare time. Michael Keaton makes for a good almost-villain. (He wasn't THAT evil if we're being honest.) 

[spoiler] I was really disappointed that Logan Marshall-Green was barely there and then got killed. Especially since I was surprised and got REALLY excited when I saw him, even though I thought he was Tom Hardy at first. Ha! [/spoiler]
Like McDonald's takeaway: exactly what I ordered (but not more) and I like McDonald's so 7/10.

What a disappointing movie. Sure it was quite enjoyable but to call it the best spiderman movie ever is an insult to those previous efforts. I understand that this spiderman is new and is not used to soaring the heights of New York City but something was missing. Tom Holland and Michael Keaton are both terrific actors, especially with Tom in that one scene in the warehouse, I could feel the pain the character was going through. But I felt as though lacked a lot of special moments, it didn't help that the score was very bland as are most marvel movies unfortunately. Nevertheless, I know the sequels will develop the spiderman character into the great one I know him to be. I'd still recommend this movie to anyone looking for a good time.

I really enjoyed this movie. There are lots of complaints because of the mix up of races and the way it differs from the original but it really doesn't affect the plot at all. A bully is a bully whether they're white or brown. The main thing about this movie is that it's just really fun. Peter's character is awesome and I liked his enthusiasm. And in the nerdy best friend and he felt like a real, quirky person and a believable 15 year old. It was nonstop and it didn't feel slow at all. When there wasn't fighting there was humor and it really kept the movie moving really well. Overall, well done and super fun!

Just GREAT! Real top spider man fan and i "have" to love every movie of it... The downside for me in this is that it has too much comedy. I it hes a teenager but he his also spider man. I didnt see much responsabilty with that great power. Again:Not an ATE comment freakin loved it and nice troll there of te second post credit scene :D
